result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of a Controlled Substance-THC. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L Daniels

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: JOC and time to pay summary

Defendant Amanda L Daniels in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:00 AM. Called 16CM15 and 16CM16. State - resolved on both matters, on 16CM15 - amend to county ordinance of possession of THC with a forfeiture of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50, on 16CM16 - plead to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, #2 - DRI, 120 days jail on each count as probation was rejected - concurrent to each other, costs only on count #3 and $100 fine plus costs on count #1. Daniels and Erickson agree. Court - 16CM15 - amend only count to county ordinance of possession of THC - pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - 60 DTP/CO after argument for longer time to pay/payment plan. Erickson again makes argument for payment plan or longer time. Court still gives 60 DTP/CO but will stay it to 60 days from release from inpatient if court receives proof that the defendant is in inpatient treatment. Court - 16CM16 - dismisses and reads in count #2. Daniels pleads NC to counts #1 and #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Erickson disagrees with what the State has said in regards to the sentence. Off record at 9:20 AM to discuss agreement further. Recalled at 9:40 AM with same appearances. State - if defendant's stance has changed - State recommends 2 years probation with same fines and costs and other conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, employment/school, 250 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor or treating physician, attend at least one AA/NA or similar self-help program per week. Erickson - her client now prefers to accept probation with no jail time and conditions as previously stated by State. Erickson makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Daniels makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with the following conditions: AODA and follow thru and aftercare of any current treatment and continue inpatient if needed, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 250 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor or treating physician, attend at least one AA/NA or similar self-help program per week, count #1 - $100.00 fine plus costs - to be paid within the first year of probation, count #3 - costs only - to be paid in the first year of probation, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Jury trial on July 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amanda L Daniels in court.  Attorney Linsday Erickson does not appear. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:25 PM. Also called 16CM16. Attorney Erickson had called previously, however court was in the middle of sentencing and Erickson had court in Shawano. Daniels makes statement that her attorney and her had a mis communication in regards to treatment. Daniels informs court there is not an agreement on either case and needs to be set for trial. Court sets for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Amanda L Daniels in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:40 AM. Daniels stated that she overslept and that is why she is late, also states she is sick. Court warns of appearing on time. Daniels understands. Court has previously read the charges. Erickson does not have complaint but did review it online, asks State to mail a copy of the complaint to her, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts in both complaints. Court accepts pleas for both matters, continues bond on both matters and sets both matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L Daniels
Current: P.O.  Box 352, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 03-11-2016)
Prior: 5607 We J Mogek Ct, Crandon, WI 54520
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Amanda L Daniels in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:41 AM. Daniels explains why she does not have an attorney today but still plans on seeking counsel, asks for more time (Hogan/Stuber), seeking inpatient treatment in Lac du Flambeau. Daniels does have both complaints. Court reads charges and penalties on both cases. Daniels understands charges and penalties, already informed Court that she will be hiring counsel. State is willing to offer a resolutuon today on one of the files. Daniels would prefer counsel. Court sets both matters for AIA. Court continues bond on 16CM16 and State asks for $1000 signature bond on 16CM15.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.
